"Geographic Projection"  For more information on the seismic surveys see http://woodshole.er.usgs.gov/operations/ia/public_ds_info.php?fa=1997-005-FA</abstract>       <purpose>To represent the geology of the West Florida Shelf Study area as delineated in U.S. Geological Survey Openfile Report 99-XXX by Scanlon, Briere, and Gledhill. These shapefiles are provided to facilitate the transfer of the interpretations to others in a GIS format or incorporation into other data sets.</purpose>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>           <caldate>19990900</caldate>         </sngdate>         <rngdates/>       </timeinfo>       <current>Publication Date</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>Irregular</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc>-085.550000</westbc>         <eastbc>-085.290000</eastbc>         <northbc>+29.110000</northbc>         <southbc>+28.950000</southbc>       </bounding>     </spdom>     <keywords>       <theme>         <themekt>Shelfbreak</themekt>         <themekey>Marine geology</themekey>         <themekey>sediment</themekey>         <themekey>sidescan sonar</themekey>         <themekey>bathymetry</themekey>       </theme>       <place>         <placekt>Geographic</placekt>         <themekey>Gulf of Mexico</themekey>         <themekey>Florida</themekey>       </place>     </keywords>     <accconst>None</accconst>     <useconst>credit or reference originators</useconst>     <ptcontac>       <cntinfo>         <cntperp>           <cntper>Kathryn M. Nodes are represented by a single coordinate pair. Polygons are used to outline bottom geology and features. Lines are used to represent contoured bathymetry and the trackline.</logic>     <complete>All sidescan sonar interpretable areas are mapped.</complete>     <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>On-board GPS measurements are used and checked with navigational charts</horizpar>       </horizpa>       <vertacc>         <vertaccr>on-board GPS measurements are used and checked with navigational charts.</vertaccr>       </vertacc>     </posacc>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>U.S. Geological Survey</origin>             <pubdate>19990900</pubdate>             <title>Coastal and Marine Geology Program</title>             <geoform>remote-sensing image</geoform>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>computer program</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>19970901</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>Publication Date</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>KMS</srccitea>         <srccontr>sidescan sonar from with geological features are interpreted</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <procstep>         <procdesc>Shapefiles were created through conversion of mapinfo files . Mapinfo files were generated based on a georeferenced image containing decimated sidescan sonar data.</procdesc>         <procdate>19990818</procdate>       </procstep>     </lineage>     <cloud>n/a</cloud>   </dataqual>   <spdoinfo>     <direct>Vector</direct>     <ptvctinf>       <vpfterm>         <vpflevel>none</vpflevel>         <vpftype>Face</vpftype>       </vpfterm>     </ptvctinf>   </spdoinfo>   <spref>     <horizsys>       <geograph>         <latres>n/a</latres>         <longres>n/a</longres>         <geogunit>Decimal degrees</geogunit>       </geograph>     </horizsys>     <vertdef>       <depthsys>         <depthdn>Mean sea level</depthdn>         <depthres>0.0</depthres>         <depthdu>Meters</depthdu>         <depthem>Explicit depth coordinate included with horizontal coordinates</depthem>       </depthsys>     </vertdef>   </spref>   <eainfo>     <detailed>       <enttyp>         <enttypl>sea floor geology</enttypl>         <enttypd>bottom type are represented by varying backscatter intensities on the sidescan sonar</enttypd>         <enttypds>Scanlon, Briere, Koenig. 1999.
